Mike Pence sent this message to supporters on his political e-mail list this afternoon: Friends and Supporters, Over the past few months, my family and I have been grateful for the encouragement we have received to consider other opportunities to serve our state and our nation in the years ahead. We have been especially humbled by the confidence and support of those who believe we should pursue the presidency, but after much deliberation and prayer, we believe our calling is closer to home.

Mike Pence announcement expected today, not tomorrow POLITICO has learned: Mike Pence is expected to announce late Thursday whether he is running for president, POLITICO has learned. The announcement will appear first in the Indianapolis Star, an aide said. Mike Pence said this was his first town hall since the Tucson, Ariz., shootings and he always consults with local law enforcement on security at such events. To me the focus is and should remain on public safety. We volunteer for these jobs, but just because someone comes to a town hall meeting, they should never have to be concerned that there's not a reasonable amount of security, he said. He said town hall meetings are "very routine" for him and said he was grateful that everyone came out Monday in the wake of the Tucson shootings.------
